units.title: Seeding AF cells in Matrigel
units.text: To investigate formation of AFOs we seeded viable AF cells in Matrigel droplets and cultured them in medium without tissue-specific signals (Supplementary Table 3).
units.rationale: Describes the initial culture step to generate organoids from amniotic fluid cells.

units.title: Establishing clonal AFO lines
units.text: To establish clonal lines, individual AFOs were picked, dissociated into single cells and replated (Fig. 2a,b).
units.rationale: Outlines how single organoids are isolated and expanded as clonal cultures.

units.title: Proliferation and apoptosis immunostaining
units.text: Immunostaining confirmed cell proliferation (Ki67) and lack of apoptosis (cleaved caspase 3) within AFOs (Fig. 2f).
units.rationale: Provides a quality‑control assay to verify organoid viability.

units.title: Epithelial vs mesenchymal marker staining
units.text: We confirmed the AFO’s epithelial identity by staining for pan-epithelial markers (EpCAM, ECAD and pan-cytokeratin) and showing absence of the mesenchymal marker PDGFRα.
units.rationale: Ensures the organoids are of epithelial origin.

units.title: Assessment of epithelial polarity
units.text: Notably, AFO’s epithelium is polarized as demonstrated by basolateral integrin β4 (ITGβ4), apical F-actin and zonula occludens-1 (ZO-1)-positive tight junctions (Fig. 2g).
units.rationale: Verifies proper apico‑basal organization of the organoid epithelium.

units.title: Maturation assay for SiAFOs
units.text: We performed a maturation assay culturing SiAFOs in intestinal-specific medium for 14 d.
units.rationale: Induces differentiation of small‑intestinal organoids toward a mature state.

units.title: Brush‑border enzyme activity assay
units.text: To evaluate SiAFO functional capacity, we assessed the digestive activity of two small intestinal brush border enzymes, dipeptidyl peptidase IV and disaccharidase.
units.rationale: Measures functional enzymatic activity of intestinal organoids.

units.title: Barrier integrity assay
units.text: We performed an inulin-FITC diffusion assay.
units.rationale: Tests the tight‑junction integrity of the organoid epithelium.

units.title: Notch inhibition experiment
units.text: We performed a Notch inhibition assay using DAPT treatment.
units.rationale: Evaluates the effect of Notch pathway blockade on organoid differentiation.

units.title: Potassium ion channel functional assay
units.text: We performed a potassium ion channel assay.
units.rationale: Assesses functional ion transport properties of kidney‑derived organoids.
